xhtml.p: What new problems would you put on the problem list?

Any of the following entries on the problem list would be acceptable:

  • Acetaminophen ingestion
What learning objectives do you have?

Be sure that the following learning objectives are also included on your list.

  • Liver toxicity of acetaminophen
  • Principles of pharmacokinetics
  • Principles of toxicology (detoxification)
After investigating your learning objectives, complete a management plan for Tyler.

Your management plan should have included the following:

  • Instruct mother to bring Tyler to the emergency department where he will have blood drawn for acetaminophen levels and be monitored at intervals and be given n-acetylcysteine.
What new problems would you put on the problem list?

Any of the following entries on the problem list would be acceptable:

  • Limp and right leg and hip pain
What learning objectives do you have?

Be sure that the following learning objectives are also included on your list.

  • Learn the anatomy of the hip (bones and joints)
  • How do bones grow in childhood?
  • In the absence of a history of trauma, the two most likely causes of hip pain and limp in a 3 year old would be toxic synovitis of the hip and septic arthritis of the hip. Compare and contrast these two problems in terms of the typical signs and symptoms of each. ["Signs" are those things that the doctor can observe objectively like fever, gait, tenderness, and laboratory tests while "symptoms" are those subjective experiences that the patient tells you about.] Which one is Tyler Nall more likely to have?
After investigating your learning objectives, complete a management plan for Tyler.

Your management plan should have included the following:

  • Some clinicians might treat Tyler empirically with anti-inflammatory analgesics for toxic synovitis of the hip based solely on the clinical presentation, while others might wish to rule out septic arthritis by obtaining some laboratory tests such as a C-reactive protein or erythrocyte sedimentation rate which would be markedly elevated in septic arthritis.
